result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Janney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All Costs to be paid to Probation-during probation period

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Janney

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

2:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J Janney in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp in court for Michael J Janney. 
22CM37 & 21CM99 tracking together:
Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 3 in 22CM37.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  21CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Klopp agrees but states that Count 3 was to be amended to remove the enhancer.  Atty Burdon responds.  

Atty Burdon moves to amend Count 3 in 22CM37 to remove the enhancer.  Atty Klopp agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Count 3 will be amended to remove the enhancer

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Count 3 in 22CM37 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  21CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
Drug Surcharge = $10.00
AODA and any follow-up treatment
No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Credit = 2 days (if revoked)

Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:30pm tomorrow 

Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  
21CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:17 AM Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video means for Defendant Michael J Janney. Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael J Janney in court.
  Atty Klopp states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.   Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.
  Court confirms address.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:23 PM Defendant Michael J Janney appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
